maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Route Table in the specified region (location).
Creates a new Route Table in the specified region (location). User defined routes can be added to the route table. The Route can be associated to a subnet in a Virtual Network.,
Name of the Route table
The location a.k.a the region in which the Route table will be created. The allowed values for this parameter are: http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/regions/
Description of the route table
Not Specified
Not Specified
Description of the route table
The location a.k.a the region in which the Route table will be created. The allowed values for this parameter are: http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/regions/
Name of the Route table
Not Specified
Not Specified

Returns the route applied in the Virtual machine. This operation could take a few seconds to complete.

Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, network, networking

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new route in the specified route table.
Creates a new route in the specified route table. Routes take effect almost immediately on the VMs associated with this route table.
The route table in which the new route is added.
Name of the new route being added.
The next hop type will be one of the supported next hops.: * VPNGateway * VNETLocal * Internet * VirtualAppliance * Null
This is needed only when NextHopType is 'VirtualAppliance'. This will be the IP address of the Appliance that will be the next hop for traffic using this route.
Not Specified
Not Specified
This is needed only when NextHopType is 'VirtualAppliance'. This will be the IP address of the Appliance that will be the next hop for traffic using this route.
The next hop type will be one of the supported next hops.: * VPNGateway * VNETLocal * Internet * VirtualAppliance * Null
Not Specified
Not Specified
Name of the new route being added.
The route table in which the new route is added.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, network, networking

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
New-AzureRouteTable -Name AppRT -Location uswest -Label 'Appliance Route Table' | Set-AzureRoute -RouteName approute -AddressPrefix 10.0.0.0/24 -NextHopType VirtualAppliance -NextHopIpAddress 10.0.1.5
Routes Name Location Label ------ ---- -------- ----- {approute} AppRT West US Appliance Route Table

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This examples shows creation of route table and inserting of a route pointing to virtual appliance

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureRouteTable -Name AppRT | Set-AzureRoute -RouteName internetRoute -AddressPrefix 0.0.0.0/0 -NextHopType Internet
Routes Name Location Label ------ ---- -------- ----- {approute, internetroute} AppRT West US Appliance Route Table

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description
This example shows insertion of a route to an existing route table

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, network, networking
Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, network, networking

maml:description.maml:para: Set the IPsec parameters that will be used for the connection between the provided virtual network gateway and local network site.

Set the IPsec parameters that will be used for the connection between the provided virtual network gateway and local network site.
The parameters that can be set on the connection are as follows: EncryptionType: (NoEncryption, RequireEncryption) PfsGroup: (PFS1, None)

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, network, networking

maml:description.maml:para: Set the pre-shared key that will be used in this virtual network gateway's connection to the provided local network site.

Set the pre-shared key that will be used in this virtual network gateway's connection to the provided local network site. The key provided to this cmdlet must be equal to the key configured on the local network site's gateway (vpn device). If the keys on the virtual network gateway and the vpn device do not match, then a connection will not be established.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, network, networking

maml:description.maml:para: Start a new gateway diagnostics session for the provided virtual network gateway.

Start a new gateway diagnostics session for the provided virtual network gateway. If a gateway diagnostics session is currently running, then this cmdlet will return an error indicating that you cannot start a new diagnostics session in the current state.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, network, networking

maml:description.maml:para: Stop a currently running diagnostics session.

This cmdlet stops a currently running diagnostics session. The results of the diagnostics session will be saved to the storage account that was provided in the initial Start-AzureVNetGatewayDiagnostics invocation.
